title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:42 <jstoldt> good morning :)

10:18 <esdaniel> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <esdaniel> hi, what's best way to embed content from an xwiki page in another xwiki page  
10:21 <jstoldt> the include macro is the way to go to achieve that  
10:22 <jstoldt> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Include+Macro  
10:22 <esdaniel> merci mes gars!  
10:22 <sabageru> has quit  
10:23 <esdaniel> @+  
10:23 <esdaniel> has left #xwiki  
10:24 <jstoldt> ... and there i was not able to undestand French very well... i just hope "mes gars" wasn't an insult ;)  
10:24 <vmassol> == thanks buggies  
10:24 <vmassol> oops  
10:24 <vmassol> buddies  
10:24 <vmassol> :)  
10:24 <jstoldt> hahaha, cool ;)  
10:27 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: need any help on the Release Notes ?  
10:45 <+sburjan> or we will use almost the same for 2.7RC1  
10:47 <jstoldt> just a thought, is there a way to receive message when ApplicationResources.properties is changed?  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: For 2.7 the RC notes will be enough  
10:48 <vmassol> jstoldt: good question  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> But I'd like to write a 2,x series summary  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Presenting the most important new features  
10:48 <jstoldt> vmassol: rendering.macro.context.content.description should probably be "The content to execute in"  
10:48 <+sburjan> so you need help ?  
10:48 <jstoldt> because you don't actuallly execute the context, do you now?  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: If you have time, sure  
10:49 <vmassol> jstoldt: you mean s/content/context?  
10:49 <jstoldt> i mean context  
10:49 <jstoldt> the important bit is the in at the end ;)  
10:49 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: so basically a merge from all the 2.x release notes with the most important features ?  
10:49 <jstoldt> stray thoughts...  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Yes, maybe with a nicer presentation  
10:49 <vmassol> I don't think so  
10:49 <vmassol> it's about describing the content field  
10:50 <vmassol> not the document param  
10:50 <jstoldt> yeah, but it means two different things  
10:50 <vmassol> rendering.macro.context.content.description=The content to execute  
10:50 <vmassol> rendering.macro.context.description=Executes content in the context of the passed document  
10:50 <jstoldt> to execute something means to make it sort of run, while execute in means to make it sort of run in something else  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Like, more text, making sure it looks consistent (redoing screenshots where needed)...  
10:50 <jstoldt> this is why i think it should be "The content to execute in"  
10:51 <vmassol> jstoldt: if you say 'the context…" then it's about context not content  
10:51 <jstoldt> oh, my bad  
10:51 <jstoldt> i read context there...  
10:51 <jstoldt> sorry, nevermind all this  
10:54 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: ok, I can try to help. But don't count on me on the API Breakages section :)  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> No, that one is not an important feature  
10:55 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: what should be the page's name I will create in ReleaseNotes space ?  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> We shouldn't list everything  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> I'd say top 10 features  
10:55 <+sburjan> okay  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> ReleaseNotesXWiki2x  
10:56 <jstoldt> oh, another thing that would be very nice to have in the ReleaseNotes henceforth would be a list of pages from the standard package that changed  
10:56 <vmassol> ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise2xCycle ?  
10:56 <jstoldt> that would ease upgrading an awful lot  
10:57 <jstoldt> right now i maintain a list of standard files i changed and then proceed to check them for relevant changes, then roll back and add those changes...  
10:57 <vmassol> jstoldt: yes that would be good. Would you be prepared to help? We have a diff app to run to get that information  
10:57 <+sburjan> vmassol: okay  
10:57 <jstoldt> vmassol: at least until end of february  
10:57 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XAR+Diff+Application  
10:57 <jstoldt> after that i will have to see... won't be this active then, i expect  
10:58 <vmassol> what would be awesome of course would be to improve that app and make it avail on xwiki.org  
10:58 <vmassol> for users to run it  
10:58 <jstoldt> indeed  
11:03 <jstoldt> hmmm it fails for me... says velocity macro fails..  
11:08 <jstoldt> vmassol: about rendering.macro.context.parameter.document.description, this is understandable if you know what is going on technically, for the technically not so interested user, i expect this is harder to understand  
11:09 <jstoldt> i would rephrase it like this: "The reference to the document the content will be executed in"  
11:16 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: do I also have to add the version in which they were introduced ?  
11:19 <vmassol> jstoldt: what fails?  
11:19 <jstoldt> the velocity in the XARDiff app  
11:19 <jstoldt> i imported it alright but apparently it fails as soon as parseGroovyFromPage...  
11:20 <vmassol> jstoldt: you have programmng irghts?  
11:20 <jstoldt> i should think so, being logged on as administrator. checking though  
11:20 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Yes  
11:20 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: You should start by listing the features you want to include  
11:20 <@sdumitriu> Make 10 headers  
11:21 <+sburjan> this is what I am doing now :)  
11:21 <+sburjan> but then I will have to re-iterate to see in which version they were introduced  
11:21 <jstoldt> okay, explicitly granted myself programming rights but still to no avail...  
11:21 <@sdumitriu> Crypto I'm not sure it's that important  
11:21 <jstoldt> still fails on parse...  
11:21 <@sdumitriu> Since it's something hidden at the moment  
11:22 <+sburjan> okay, I will take that out  
11:22 <vmassol> jstoldt: I've used it not long ago  
11:22 <+sburjan> the list isn't yet ready.. when I think it's ready I'll ping you so you cand give me your opinion  
11:22 <vmassol> so it's probbaly a minor thinh  
11:22 <vmassol> can you fix it?  
11:22 <vmassol> I can help if you pastebin the error you get  
11:22 <jstoldt> okay, i can try  
11:22 <jstoldt> hold on  
11:23 <jstoldt> http://pastebin.ca/2025291  
11:23 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: add "Clustering"  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Deleted docs+attachments  
11:24 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: New profile UI  
11:25 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Document templates  
11:25 <@sdumitriu> Invitation Manager  
11:26 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: There should be a meta-section about UI improvements, including all the improvements to the editors, search, comments, attachments, menus  
11:27 <cjdelisle> more flexible registration interface?  
11:28 <jstoldt> any hints, vmassol?  
11:28 <vmassol> jstoldt: multitasking between 4-5 different things  
11:29 <jstoldt> sorry, did not mean to nag  
11:30 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: where can I find "Clustering" ?  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: We're lacking documentation on that, but see here:  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Clustering  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/DistributedEventClusterSetup  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise20#H6Clustering  
11:32 <Menso> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <sabageru> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <@sdumitriu> sabageru: What's the status on LDAP?  
11:42 <sabageru> hello sdumitriu, no success so far  
11:42 <@sdumitriu> Well, I think you can try to do this:  
11:44 <vmassol> jstoldt: I've just ran it on trunk and it has worked fine for me… http://pastebin.com/mimEVQ51  
11:44 <vmassol> (this is hte list of changes between 1.9.4 and 2.7-SNAPSHOT)  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> in plugin.ldap.XWikiLDAPConfig#getLDAPBindDN  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> LDAPDN.escapeRDN(login)  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> If login contains =, do nothing  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> Else, login = "cn=" + login  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> And remove cn= after that  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> after the escape  
11:46 <sabageru> i will try that  
11:53 <+jvelociter> there is a release today is that it ?  
11:53 <+jvelociter> I just found a bug I'd like to commit before, is that possible ?  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: There will be as soon as we fix LDAP  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: What bug?  
11:57 <+jvelociter> XWIKI-5821  
11:57 <+jvelociter> I have the fix  
11:58 <+jvelociter> will be quick to commit  
11:58 <@sdumitriu> K, go ahead  
11:59 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: is  ther any way to insert an image from another wiki ? something like [[image:@platform:Features:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]]  
12:00 <@sdumitriu> Why @platform?  
12:00 <+sburjan> because I have found better screenshots for the release notes page, and I'd like to create it without ataching any picture to it  
12:01 <+sburjan> because the screenshot is on the platform wiki  
12:01 <@sdumitriu> Why @?  
12:01 <+sburjan> well .. I don't know :)  
12:01 <@sdumitriu> [[image:platform:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]]  
12:01 <+sburjan> let me try  
12:03 <+sburjan> works. you saved me :)  
12:09 <jstoldt> vmassol: i don't get it... i gave myself programming rights, i deleted the XARDiff space and imported it anew but it will still fail on parsing the groovy

14:05 <+lucaa> guys, how do we indent velocity scripts? 2 spaces or 4?  
14:05 <+lucaa> in XE I mean  
14:06 <@sdumitriu> lucaa: 2  
14:06 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: thanks  
14:07 <+lucaa> I was just looking for the best practices document without too much success  
14:07 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Deleted docs&attach should be a standalone item  
14:08 <+sburjan> ok  
14:08 <+sburjan> :d  
14:18 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Office preview  
14:18 <+sburjan> thanks  
14:20 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:23 <vmassol> lucaa: create one ;)  
14:24 <vmassol> (after proposing a standard)  
14:24 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/CodeStyle  
14:24 <+lucaa> vmassol: I think it's there somewhere, i remember we agreed on this  
14:24 <+lucaa> maybe not published in the right place  
14:24 <vmassol> I do't remember seeing one  
14:25 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HJavaScriptBestPractices  
14:25 <vmassol> ?  
14:31 <sandokan> has left #xwiki  
14:42 <esdaniel> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <esdaniel> hi, what's best way to apply extra css to some xwiki content, can i 'include' as an attachment to wiki page?  
14:44 <cjdelisle> Try using a CSSExtension  
14:45 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <cjdelisle> There's a class called StyleSheetExtensionClass (IIRC) and you can define your CSS in that and add it as an object to the document you want it to be used on.  
14:45 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <esdaniel> yep cjdelisle, that seems to be the case, add object: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial thkx  
14:51 <esdaniel> vmassol: the ow2 xwiki skin has omitted the ability to add objects :-(  
14:51 <vmassol> esdaniel: this is the wrong channel I believe for this :)  
14:52 <esdaniel> vmassol: sorry  
14:52 <vmassol> you should contact XWiki SAS' support I think  
14:52 <esdaniel> will do  
14:56 <esdaniel> doh! been working too hard again... the feature was located in a panel on the right... must get more sleep!  
14:57 <vmassol> hehe  
14:58 <esdaniel> vmassol: btw i guess you saw the new project submission, might interest xwiki - java-xml binding with bytecode acceleration: http://www.jibx.org/  
14:59 <vmassol> esdaniel: I saw the name quickly but haven't looked in it  
14:59 <vmassol> thanks for the pointer  
14:59 <esdaniel> my pleasure  
15:01 <vmassol> sdumitriu, sburjan: do as you see fit for the 2.x cycle doc  
15:01 <vmassol> I'm not opposed to anything  
15:01 <+sburjan> well me neither, I'll do it as you want it  
15:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> Hm, better to move it outside the ReleaseNotes space  
15:02 <vmassol> sdumitriu: just as a blog entry then?  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:02 <+sburjan> well .. I will move it after it's finished. It's has no backlinks ATM  
15:02 <+sburjan> so it's invisible  
15:03 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: so I should try to make it shorter ?  
15:03 <+sburjan> remove some of the content ?  
15:03 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Yes  
15:03 <+sburjan> ok  
15:03 <@sdumitriu> Keep one or two lines for description, and one picture  
15:04 <@sdumitriu> In this case the UI section is out of the plan  
15:04 <+sburjan> that's gonna be hard, but okay .. I'll replace removed content and images with links  
15:04 <+sburjan> is it ok like this ?  
15:04 <+sburjan> because from a user POV, UI is the most visible thing  
15:05 <@sdumitriu> We'll keep it, but much smaller  
15:05 <+sburjan> ok  
15:05 <+sburjan> executing  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> Just one screenshot  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> Keep in mind that 1.9 had Toucan  
15:08 <+sburjan> I know  
15:08 <+sburjan> I'll keep the Colibri image (first image)  
15:08 <+sburjan> to illustrate the "jump"  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> Hm, I'd like to have some avatars in it  
15:10 <sabageru> sumitriu: managed to get past the error with "=" in ldap tests. now it fails with error LDAPException: Invalid Credentials (49) Invalid Credentials  
15:10 <sabageru> LDAPException: Server Message: Bind failed: null. is there a way for me to setup an LDAP server on my local instance that is documented on xwiki ?  
15:10 <sabageru> sdumitriu : see above  
15:11 <@sdumitriu> sabageru: No idea, never worked with it  
15:12 <@sdumitriu> How many tests fail?  
15:12 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: take a look now.  
15:13 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: What should I look for?  
15:13 <+sburjan> I've removed a lot of images, compacted the content.  
15:13 <+sburjan> blog-article style  
15:17 <sabageru> sdumitriu: same as before but this time the error is different. so i was hoping somebody has a clue on how to setup a (mockup) LDAP on my localhost  
15:18 <esdaniel> has left #xwiki  
15:20 <sabageru> tmortagne, vmassol: do you have any idea ? i am trying to fix ldap-test. they fail with LDAPException: Server Message: Bind failed: null . I probably need an LDAP server setup on my local instance and i do not know exactly how to do it. Maybe you have some guides or something wht would work for xwiki  
15:22 <vmassol> sabageru: i don't know anything about our LDAP impl  
15:22 <vmassol> there are some tests in enterprise/  
15:22 <vmassol> automated tests  
15:22 <vmassol> that start an LDAP server automaticlly  
15:23 <vmassol> indeed, it's in ldap-tests  
15:23 <sabageru> hmm.. the tests are failing at this moment. are you sure they start an LDAP automatically ?  
15:23 <vmassol> yes  
15:23 <vmassol> well i'm sure they have everything required to run  
15:23 <vmassol> and I'm pretty sure they start an LDAP server auomatically  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> {{code}} macro fails on xwiki.org http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/JavaScriptAPI  
15:35 <vmassol> sdumitriu: use language  = none for now  
15:35 <vmassol> thomas fixed it I believe  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> No  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> It only happened once  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> It had the right language set  
15:36 <vmassol> ok maybe it's something else, I've see that too  
15:36 <@sdumitriu> Refreshing made the problem go away  
15:36 <@sdumitriu> My favorite kind of bug, the one you can't catch  
15:36 <vmassol> yep  
15:42 <jvelociter> has quit  
15:51 <camaritei> has left #xwiki  
15:52 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: any wild idea how to remove borders of multiple images with gimp ?  
15:52 <+sburjan> because on the 2.2 Release Notes you created 2 or 3 px black border  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> Write a python script  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> But I've never done that  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> 2px  
15:53 <+sburjan> but we're talking about flatten images  
15:53 <+sburjan> static  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> Actually I did write once a script to process an image  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> But it was a long time ago and I forgot all about it  
15:53 <+sburjan> I don;t think that pyton can process images in this way  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> No, not python standalone  
15:53 <+sburjan> ps : images don't have all the same size  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> Gimp scripts are written in Python  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> Gimp provides the image manipulation API  
15:54 <+sburjan> I see  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> It's neatly documented  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> Just that I didn't read the documentation :)  
16:09 <ralucaM> has quit  
16:13 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: any way to download ALL attachments from a page by one click ?  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> No  
16:15 <+jvdrean> I think I've spotted a nasty bug on 2.6, could someone confirm, I'm not able to add XWiki.XWikiGroups objects in wiki page  
16:15 <+sburjan> grrrrrr  
16:15 <+jvdrean> neither from the object editor nor from velocity  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> jvdrean: What are you doing?  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Actually you can using WebDAV  
16:16 <+jvdrean> sdumitriu: just using the object editor, nothing special  
16:17 <@sdumitriu> jvdrean: Indeed, after refresh it's gone  
16:17 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: so i'd need a WebDav client  
16:17 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Gnome is a WebDAV client  
16:18 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: following tutorial, but without success :))  
16:19 <+sburjan> # Mount an XWiki wiki content into the user's local file system.  
16:20 <florinciu> has quit  
16:21 <+sburjan> what does this mea ?  
16:21 <+sburjan> mean  
16:22 <+sburjan> I need to use WebDav with xwiki.org  
16:22 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: What tutorial?  
16:23 <+sburjan> http://www.webdavsystem.com/server/access/gnome\_nautilus  
16:24 <+sburjan> do i need special credential, or just my user ?  
16:24 <@sdumitriu> Your user  
16:24 <+lucaa> guys, I would like to commit XE-756 and XE-722 (more or less finished)  
16:24 <@sdumitriu> I think the URL is different  
16:24 <+lucaa> should i put them as well in 2.7?  
16:24 <@sdumitriu> www.xwiki.org/xwiki/webdav  
16:24 <+lucaa> or only in 3.0?
